channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MAHOUT-1516] run classify-20newsgroups.sh failed cause by /tmp/mahout-work-jpan/20news-all does not exists in hdfs.
item.description:
+ echo 'Copying 20newsgroups data to HDFS'
Copying 20newsgroups data to HDFS
+ set +e
+ /home/jpan/Software/hadoop-2.2.0/bin/hadoop dfs -rmr /tmp/mahout-work-jpan/20news-all
DEPRECATED: Use of this script to execute hdfs command is deprecated.
Instead use the hdfs command for it.

rmr: DEPRECATED: Please use 'rm -r' instead.
14/04/17 10:26:25 WARN util.NativeCodeLoader: Unable to load native-hadoop library for your platform... using builtin-java classes where applicable
rmr: `/tmp/mahout-work-jpan/20news-all': No such file or directory
+ set -e
+ /home/jpan/Software/hadoop-2.2.0/bin/hadoop dfs -put /tmp/mahout-work-jpan/20news-all /tmp/mahout-work-jpan/20news-all
DEPRECATED: Use of this script to execute hdfs command is deprecated.
Instead use the hdfs command for it.

14/04/17 10:26:26 WARN util.NativeCodeLoader: Unable to load native-hadoop library for your platform... using builtin-java classes where applicable
put: `/tmp/mahout-work-jpan/20news-all': No such file or directory
item.summary: run classify-20newsgroups.sh failed cause by /tmp/mahout-work-jpan/20news-all does not exists in hdfs.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
• 97,102 ****
      • 97,103 ----
        set +e
        $HADOOP dfs -rmr $ {WORK_DIR}/20news-all
        set -e
        + $HADOOP dfs -mkdir -p ${WORK_DIR}

        /20news-all
        $HADOOP dfs -put $

        {WORK_DIR}/20news-all ${WORK_DIR}

        /20news-all
        fi
Jian Pan I think the -p option to mkdir is specific to Hadoop 2.x, can someone confirm that? Have you tried whether the script also works without the -p option?
hadoop dfs -mkdir -p does not work with hadoop 1.2.1. Jian Pan were you able to get the script working without making any other changes to your hadoop config?
This bug has been tagged as 'PATCH AVAILABLE', where is this patch, or is it just that the issue has now been resolved in trunk?

We'll need to use hadoop dfs -rmr in as long as we support hadoop 1.2.1.

Running classify-20newsgroups.sh on hadoop 2.2.0 in pseudo-cluster mode i get no errors:

+ '[' /home/andy/apache/hadoop-2.2.0 '!=' '' ']'
+ '[' '' == '' ']'
+ echo 'Copying 20newsgroups data to HDFS'
Copying 20newsgroups data to HDFS
+ set +e
+ /home/andy/apache/hadoop-2.2.0/bin/hadoop dfs -rmr /tmp/mahout-work-andy/20news-all
DEPRECATED: Use of this script to execute hdfs command is deprecated.
Instead use the hdfs command for it.

rmr: DEPRECATED: Please use 'rm -r' instead.
15/03/29 20:32:06 WARN util.NativeCodeLoader: Unable to load native-hadoop library for your platform... using builtin-java classes where applicable
15/03/29 20:32:07 INFO fs.TrashPolicyDefault: Namenode trash configuration: Deletion interval = 0 minutes, Emptier interval = 0 minutes.
Deleted /tmp/mahout-work-andy/20news-all

Creating sequence files from 20newsgroups data
+ ./bin/mahout seqdirectory -i /tmp/mahout-work-andy/20news-all -o /tmp/mahout-work-andy/20news-seq -ow
MAHOUT_LOCAL is not set; adding HADOOP_CONF_DIR to classpath.
Running on hadoop, using /home/andy/apache/hadoop-2.2.0/bin/hadoop and HADOOP_CONF_DIR=/home/andy/apache/hadoop-2.2.0/etc/hadoop
MAHOUT-JOB: /home/andy/sandbox/mahout/examples/target/mahout-examples-1.0-SNAPSHOT-job.jar

oops.. spoke too soon must have added the HDFS directory by hand when I was walking through the steps by step Naive Bayes example.

we do need to create the base tmp/mahout-work-user directory in HDFS

will do this today.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Mahout-Quality #3030 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Mahout-Quality/3030/)
